datafield.subfield: [Madkhal ilá al-falsafah al-ḥadīthah al-maʻa Makātīb ʻAbd al-Bahāʼ,
265-310 x 210 mm. bound to 321 x 222 mm.
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 913
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; both texts likely copied in Egypt in the late 1930s and at some stage bound together for James Heyworth-Dunne (d.1974).
Former shelfmark: Mich. Isl. Ms. temp. no. 62

Binding: Boards covered in dark green cloth with dark green leather over spine (quarter binding) ; pastedowns and flyleaves in wove paper printed with a floral vegetal pattern in green ; spine gold-stamped with title and decorative accents over raised bands "مدخل الفلسفة الحديثة | J.H.D." ; sewing difficult to examine ; stuck-on endbands (blue and white stripe) ; overall in fairly good condition.

Support: Each section in a distinct type of paper ; section carrying opening work mainly on a coated laid paper stamped "محل محمود محمد الوكيل وفرحات ابراهيم بمصر" with a few sheets of lined wove paper mixed in ; section carrying second work on lined / ruled wove paper.

Script: Ruqʻah ; two quick, modern hands in a medium to bold line ; serifless and freely ligatured with mainly closed counters, slight effect of words descending to baseline, pointing somewhat careless and in strokes rather than distinct dots.
Layout: Written in mainly 16 and 26 lines per page.

Collation: Two distinct sections, each carrying a work, now bound together ; foliation in black ink, Hindu-Arabic numerals in opening section carrying Min Makātīb ʻAbd al-Bahāʼ which has verso of each leaf left blank ; opening leaf of a draft of another text on modern philosophy (see Isl. Ms. 916) mistakenly inserted after the opening leaf of the Bahai text (see p.3) ; pages between sections of second work (Madkhal al-falsafah al-ḥadīthah) left fully or partially blank to serve as 'title pages' (see pp.45, 65, 85, 105, 125, 145, 161 ), irregular internal pagination, Hindu-Arabic numerals, in some sections ; pagination in pencil (entire volume), Western numerals, supplied during digitization.
Explicit: "وللمنطق وضع كتابه المعروف رسالة القوة العاقلة البشرية وكتاب المدعو عن مسلك القوة العاقلة"

Incipit: "مدخل الفلسفة الحديثة مذهب التحقيق الحديث مقدمة ان المصاعب التي تحيط بمهمة تقديم صورة شاملة عن مذهب التحقيق الحديث في مقام رقيق ومجال ضيق ... خطيرة جدا والسبب في ذلك غالبا هو ان مذهب التحقيق ليس كلا من تعليم منظم ..."
2. p.3 : [opening leaf of a draft copy of Madkhal al-falsafah al-ḥadīthah, the rest of which has been bound in Isl. Ms. 916].
Bausani, A. and D. MacEoin. "ʿABD-AL-BAHĀʾ." In Encyclopædia Iranica, I/1, 1012-104

Careful copy of an anonymous text on modern philosophy (compare texts in Isl. Ms. 908 v.2 and Isl. Ms. 916) with a selection from the letters of ʻAbd al-Bahāʼ ʻAbbās Afandī (d.1921) bound in preceding it.

On upper pastedown label with ex libris of James Heyworth-Dunne (d.1974), stamped with inventory number, "Ex Libris | J. Heyworth-Dunne | D. Lit. (London) | No 7951" ; UM Library inscription on p.1 "Dunning | Heyworth-Dunne | 6-13-51 | 71955" ; glosses and marginal corrections.
[مدخل الى الفلسفة الحديثة مع مكاتيب عبد البهاء,
